description: Before the shepherds take their flocks of sheep to the pasture, there are 100 hectares of grass available.
Given the current situation, if each shepherd take more than 10 flocks of sheep to the pasture, consuming 10 hectares of grass, the available grass in the pasture will decrease next month
Kate took 5 flocks of sheep to the pasture, thus consuming 5 hectares of grass.

The conversation between the shepherds revolves around the monthly pasture report, with John expressing concern about Luke's large consumption of grass, Kate arguing that taking more sheep to the pasture will benefit its sustainability in the long run, and Emma suggesting that they should prioritize the pasture's health and take fewer sheep to avoid overgrazing.
conversation: Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly pasture report. John consumed 20 hectares of grass. Kate consumed 5 hectares of grass. Jack consumed 5 hectares of grass. Emma consumed 10 hectares of grass. Luke consumed 50 hectares of grass.
Wow, Luke, consuming 50 hectares of grass is quite a lot. Are you sure you want to take that many sheep to the pasture next month? It might not be good for the pasture's sustainability.

I understand your concern, John. However, I believe that taking a few more flocks of sheep to the pasture next month will actually benefit the sustainability of the pasture in the long run. With the remaining grass doubling in quantity after each month, the pasture will be able to support more sheep without running out of grass. Plus, as shepherds, we want to maximize our income, and taking more sheep to the pasture will give us a better chance of doing so.

I see what you're saying, Kate. But I'm not sure I agree. Taking too many sheep to the pasture could lead to overgrazing and deplete the grass supply. As shepherds, we have a responsibility to protect the pasture and ensure its sustainability for future generations. Maybe we should consider taking fewer sheep to the pasture next month and prioritize the health of the pasture instead of just maximizing our income.
